title: Auxiliary normed space
summary: In functional analysis, two methods of constructing normed spaces from disks were systematically employed by Alexander Grothendieck to define nuclear operators and nuclear spaces.[1] One method is used if the disk D {\displaystyle D} is bounded: in this case, the auxiliary normed space is span ‚Å° D {\displaystyle \operatorname {span} D} with norm
